title: Lissandra got an S, Leblanc did not. Check it out and learn something
body:
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2233784944/44704340?tab=overview

I made this so you could compare it to other S rank games or games you thought should be an S rank based on your inadequate or nonexistent standards. It is NOT just about KDR, its more than that.

replies.body: holy shit.... 40 mins and those cs scores XD

> [{quoted}](name=Mig89,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VE96zWWE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-07-07T04:19:26.172+0000)
>
> holy shit.... 40 mins and those cs scores XD

They were losing horribly early until some of them actually did what I told them and I set up a lot of kills for them. They swore Leblanc was carrying... whatever lol. 

Enemy got all salty whenever I typed an #outplayed 

Yasuo was extremely salty when I predicted which bush he'd be arriving at repeatedly which is part of how leblanc got 30 kills despite getting no S rank like I did as lissandra

>Enemy got all salty whenever I typed an #outplayed

Why were you being a jerk, though?

If I remember right they fired the first shots though they may have done it because my teammate was bitching in all chat. I cant remember when exactly but somehow we got on the subject on who was actually carrying the match either because leblanc was bitching or the enemy was whining about how broken leblanc was. I believe both happened but I forget in which order. At some point I declared that I was the one carrying as the support and ventured to prove it with predictions and outplay. I've always kept such taunting very simple without too many extreme personal attacks. I assume I didn't do anything different this time.
Maybe the first time as a joke, but doing it more than once is overkill. Even if they fire the first shots, repeated taunting begins to be harassment.

Maybe so. But that's why you don't taunt the enemy team to hurt their morale, or someone might do something, perhaps even something reasonable, to counteract this. Joking or not, I was likely doing it for a sortof practical reason

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VE96zWWE,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-07-07T05:01:37.469+0000)
>
> They were losing horribly early until some of them actually did what I told them and I set up a lot of kills for them. They swore Leblanc was carrying... whatever lol. 
> 
> Enemy got all salty whenever I typed an #outplayed 
> 
> Yasuo was extremely salty when I predicted which bush he'd be arriving at repeatedly which is part of how leblanc got 30 kills despite getting no S rank like I did as lissandra

Could i ask,, when you mentioned ' Enemy got all salty whenever I typed an #outplayed '. Is this because they were able to communicate with you during game? or was it all in the end-of-game queue.

thanks

Based off the wording I used and my vague memory of it I'd say it was ingame. I had time to type ingame but remember I was playing support liss this game. Just won the game by communicating and setting up big plays they couldn't really deal with.

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VE96zWWE,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2016-09-11T06:49:37.734+0000)
>
> Based off the wording I used and my vague memory of it I'd say it was ingame. I had time to type ingame but remember I was playing support liss this game. Just won the game by communicating and setting up big plays they couldn't really deal with.

Thank you, i was just wondering if you had the capability to see what enemy was typing among themselves, during in-game. There are reports of people using thirdparty programs allowing them to see the in-game enemy chat .
weird reason to revive a 2 month old thread lol
Yeah, I felt a little queasy when I noticed that.
It was a support Lissandra, and she got more cs than the mid Leblanc...
